de.braintags.io.vertx.pojomapper.typehandler

Interface ITypeHandler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ITypeHandlerReferenced
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDateTypeHandler, AbstractDecimalTypeHandler, AbstractNumericTypeHandler, AbstractTypeHandler, BigDecimalTypeHandler, BigIntegerTypeHandler, BooleanTypeHandler, ByteTypeHandler, CalendarTypeHandler, CharacterTypeHandler, CharSequenceTypeHandler, ClassTypeHandler, DateTypeHandler, DoubleTypeHandler, EnumTypeHandler, FloatTypeHandler, GeoPointTypeHandler, IntegerTypeHandler, JsonTypeHandler, LocaleTypeHandler, LongTypeHandler, ObjectTypeHandler, PriceTypeHandler, ShortTypeHandler, TimestampTypeHandler, TimeTypeHandler, URITypeHandler, URLTypeHandler

    public interface ITypeHandler
extends java.lang.Cloneable
    The ITypehandler is responsible to change original values into the required format of the used datastore. Cause ITypeHandler can have stateful information based on the IField, where an ITypeHandler is belonging to, each IField is getting its own clone

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static short MATCH_MAJOR
      Returned by method matches(IField) to specify that the current typehandler handles the given field in a major way.
      static short MATCH_MINOR
      Returned by method matches(IField) to specify that the current typehandler handles the given field in a minor way.
      static short MATCH_NONE
      Returned by method matches(IField) to specify that the current typehandler won't handle the given field

      • MATCH_MINOR

        static final short MATCH_MINOR
        Returned by method matches(IField) to specify that the current typehandler handles the given field in a minor way. For instance, if the class of the field is not direct the class, which the typehandler deals with, but an instance of
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MATCH_MAJOR

        static final short MATCH_MAJOR
        Returned by method matches(IField) to specify that the current typehandler handles the given field in a major way. For instance, if the class of the field is the direct class
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • fromStore

        void fromStore(java.lang.Object source,
               IField field,
               java.lang.Class<?> cls,
               io.vertx.core.Handler<io.vertx.core.AsyncResult<ITypeHandlerResult>> resultHandler)
        This method is called when a value is read from a field of a mapped object and must change the value into the needed format and type
        Parameters:
        source - the source, which was read from the datastore
        field - the underlaying field information
        cls - if a caller can't access some IField information, then the resulting class should be defined here
        resultHandler - the method will store the result inside the ITypeHandlerResult

      • intoStore

        void intoStore(java.lang.Object source,
               IField field,
               io.vertx.core.Handler<io.vertx.core.AsyncResult<ITypeHandlerResult>> resultHandler)
        This method is called when an object shall be persisted into the datastore and shall change the value into the needed format of the datastore
        Parameters:
        source - the source, which was read from the java instance
        field - the underlaying field information
        resultHandler - the method will store the result inside the ITypeHandlerResult

      • matches

        short matches(IField field)
        Checks wether the given IField is matching the criteria in the current instance. The method returns a graded result, one of MATCH_NONE, MATCH_MINOR or MATCH_MAJOR
        Parameters:
        field - the field to be checked
        Returns:
        MATCH_NONE if the field is not handled by the current instance, MATCH_MINOR if it is fitting partially ( like a subclass for instance ) or MATCH_MAJOR if it is highly fitting, like the exact class for instance

      • matches

        short matches(java.lang.Class<?> cls,
              java.lang.annotation.Annotation embedRef)
        Checks wether the given Class is matching the criteria in the current instance. The method returns a graded result, one of MATCH_NONE, MATCH_MINOR or MATCH_MAJOR
        Parameters:
        cls - the Class to be checked
        embedRef - an annotation of type Referenced or Embedded or NULL. ITypeHandler can react to this information
        Returns:
        0 ( zero ) if the Typ

      • getTypeHandlerFactory

        ITypeHandlerFactory getTypeHandlerFactory()
        Get the ITypeHandlerFactory where the current instance is belonging to.
        Returns:

      • getSubTypeHandler

        ITypeHandler getSubTypeHandler(java.lang.Class<?> subClass,
                               java.lang.annotation.Annotation embedRef)
        Some ITypeHandler, which are processing List, Array, Map etc., are using sub handler to process the values of the List etc. Those handler must not come from out of the same ITypeHandlerFactory. For example can decide a CollectionHandler, that it serializes all children into JSon and thus is using the JSonTypeHandlerFactory to define the typehandlers
        Parameters:
        subClass - the class to be examined
        embedRef - an annotation of type Referenced or Embedded or NULL. ITypeHandler can react to this information
        Returns:
        a valid ITypeHandler

      • clone

        java.lang.Object clone()
        Generates a new copy of this instance.
        Returns:
        a copy of this instance
        See Also:
        Object.clone()
